results.title: The Competitive spirit (NP)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Marketing in Practice”.
Deals with one of the best known and least documented problems of corporate management - status-seeking, empire-building and interdepartmental politics. Stimulates managers and executives to look at their behaviour, their motives and the problems of corporate communication in a new light. Cast includes John Cleese, Peter Bayliss. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: The Competitive Edge
results.brief_description: A study of Victoria’s economic strategy for growth which singles out areas of competitive strength. The nine areas selected for government support include: 1)industrial skills; 2)commercial centre; 3)research capability; 4)brown coal; 5)off shore oil; 6)agriculture; 7)location centrality; 8)national role as cultural and commercial centre; 9)tourism.

results.title: The Compenius Organ in Denmark
results.creator_credit: Dansk Kulturfilm, Nordisk Films Kompagni and Christen Jul
results.brief_description: At Frederiksborg Palace is the famous organ constructed in wood by Esaias Compenius of Brunswick. Kept in working order since 1610, it is a living witness to the love of music which enriched the reign of Christian IV. In the film, the music of Buxtehude (who had considerable influence on J.S. Bach) brings out many of its unique beauties. Tapestries by Hans Kneiper, included in the film, illustrate daily life of the 17th century.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dansk Kulturfilm, Nordisk Films Kompagni and Christen Jul

results.title: The Company of wolves
results.creator_credit: Palace Pictures, Chris Brown, Stephen Woolley and Neil Jordan
results.brief_description: This innovative, intelligent and visually sumptuous horror film is not a traditional werewolf movie, it explores the psychosexual undercurrents of the classic “Little Red Riding Hood” fairytale. Set almost entirely within the dreams and fantasy of thirteen year old Rosaleen who is stirred by passion; it foretells the fate of all young girls who stray from the forest path. Director Jordan is a distinctive stylist who knows how to convey the complex emotions and simmering sensuality of Angela Carter’s story. Stars Angela Lansbury as Granny and Sarah Patterson as Rosaleen. Screenplay by Angela Carter and Neil Jordan, adapted from a story by Angela Carter.

results.title: The Company of strangers [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David Wilson, ONF | NFB and Cynthia Scott
results.brief_description: A bus breaks down in the wilderness. Eight elderly women, average age 71, are stranded at a deserted farmhouse. They have only their wits, their memories, and eventually some roasted frogs’ legs, to sustain them. Through the long days and nights this remarkable group of strangers share their life stories and exchange intimate thoughts; turning the crisis into a magical time of humour and spirit. Featuring non-professional actors and spontaneous dialogue, this memorable film dissolves the barrier between fiction and reality, weaving a heartwarming tale of friendship and courage. Cast: Cissy Meddings, Mary Meigs, Catherine Roche, Michelle Sweeney, Beth Webber, Alice Diabo, Constance Garneau, Winifred Holden. Script, Gloria Demers, Cynthia Scott, David Wilson and Sally Bochner. Cinematography, David de Volpi. Music, Marie Bernard. Editing, David Wilson.

results.title: The Company of officer cadets
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Artransa Park Studios and Phillip Mark-Law
results.brief_description: A career as an Army Officer is one which might not normally occur to a young man choosing his future profession. The busy life of young men at one of Australia’s officer-training schools where, behind the parades, formal social functions and tradition, there is difficult and demanding study to train men for battle and for times of national disaster.

results.title: The Company computers and the unions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Systems Organisation the Management of Complexity”.
This film was made at the Pearl Assurance Company where recent developments in office technology, specifically microcomputers, is beginning to have a dramatic impact on the kinds of work that the staff at Pearl produce.

results.title: The Communicators
results.brief_description: Radio communications have made tremendous advances in the 20th century and the Army keeps up with them in this important facet of military operations. Specialists and equipment of the Royal Australian Corps of Signals feature in this interesting film.

results.title: The Communications explosion
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, James B. Faichney and Columbia Briadcasting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Probable future communication methods and systems, emphasising use of computers. Some experimental devices are shown illustrating verbal computer input and output.

results.title: The Communal sense of modesty = Il commune senso del pudore
results.creator_credit: Fausto Saraceni, Rizzoli Film and Alberto Sordi
results.brief_description: Four humorous vignettes starring and directed by top Italian comic actor Alberto Sordi which take place on the same day. The first tells of a conservative married couple in search of a movie theatre which take place on the same day. The second is about life in a successful magazine company. The third deals with the increasing popularity of sex magazines in Italy. The fourth and final story tells of a ‘primadonna’ actress constantly throwing tantrums in a film studio. In Italian language with no English subtitles.
